SENT.plain: This case report described a patient of BehÃ§et disease (BD)-related vascular lesions that initially presented as occlusion of superior vena cava (SVC) without any evidence of thrombosis
The patient was treated first by percutaneous transluminal angioplasty and stent implantation, and he developed thrombosis in the stent and then received open bypass operation
Pathologic examination of the SVC specimen and the postoperative manifestations revealed that the underlying cause of his symptoms as BD
Afterward, methylprednisolone plus anticoagulant therapy was routinely given, which relieved the symptoms of the patient
